Summary: Filthy, bad area, smelled terrible, air conditioner smelled bad, sketchy people everywhere.   Way too far from any restaurants to walk not that we would have in that area.   Thankfully just 1 night before a flight.  Spend a bit more and stay closer to the beach or at a hotel closer to aorport

The lady at the front desk was so welcoming and lovely! The room was amazing and clean, facilities were good,  definitely one of the best places i stayed during my travels! Would highly recommend :))))

Summary Heading: Stay away from this hotel, if possible.
Summary: Please book a different hotel, this is a shady and dirty hotel. The carpet was not vacuumed, the towels had long, black hair in them, there is mold everywhere, you can hear everything in the room next door and the sheets were stained. To top it off, we found a sex toy under the mattress when checking for bed bugs. To compensate us, we were offered a 10% discount. Horrible accommodation.

My husband and I spend almost 10 days at this motel. It was a good value for the price. The amenities were decent. The only problems were the bed bugs and how the management handled the situation.  Within the last three nights of our stay, our body were covered in bed bug bites and it was horrible. Took this matter to the management, they first denied it were bed bugs , and then they said I must have brought the bed bugs with me!  Anyways. We checked out and retrieved the money for the two more days I had booked with them. But overall, I was disappointed with how they handled this matter.

Summary Heading: Beware. Unsafe and disgusting - WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!!
Summary: This is the worst hotel experience I have ever encountered. I checked in late and was put in room 27. The room has holes in the walls, missing lightbulbs and many other issues. The sink took 45 minutes to drain. The biggest concern is the MISSING SMOKE DETECTOR. I went to the front desk to complain and they said that they would switch me to another room. Then they called and said that they were booked and could not move me to another room. I honestly am completely flabbergasted at the lack of any kind of customer service at this property. I asked to speak to the manager and was told he is off until Monday. Beware. Do not stay here!!!

I stayed here for work the staff was friendly n I was alone n felt very safe. My only concern was the accessibility room bathroom shower seat was broken .thank full im not disabled but if I wasn't able to stand it would have been a problem

Our first stop on the Boyz Annual trip. Chosen for it's excellent location, near to Newport Beach. Just off Highway 55 in Costa Mesa. Cleanish rooms for a very reasonable price. Good service from reception.

Summary Heading: Best value in all of Orange County
Summary: Friendly clean and perfect location. Front desk was very pleasant and friendly. Highly recommend! I was having trouble using PayPal and the hotel honored the pricing. My new GO TO motel  Close by to everything including cheapest  Gas  around

this crack hotel has got to be the worst, filthy, place run by the cheepest people ive ever encountered. first of all i was in room #5. a handicap accessible room. the bathroom reaked of human fecies covered up by bleech! gagging! i went to take a shower in the morning and there was crumbs of human fecies in the shower!!!!!!! this is being reported to the health department. on top of it all these cheap crack hotel owners charged an additional 56.00 on my credit card 2 days later. i called to see why and they said room damage! now i have stayed in hundreds of hotels in my life, but i have never had this happen by cheap terrible hotel owners!! they claim there was blood and a towel and a sheet. nobody was bleeding in our room. i left very early in the morning after one night stay.

i asked for a room downstairs because i had alot of luggage and a stroller. there was  no availability downstairs so i ended up being put in a room upstairs my first nights in staying here which i didnt mind because i was put in a nice clean spacious room, the room was perfectly clean for my baby , and carpet was safe for him in case he fell and thats all that mattered to me , i felt like i got what i was paying for , until my last night of staying here. According to the lady in the front desk, I was then switched to an "upgraded room" downstairs which wasnt true , the room was a complete disaster. I felt like i had been lied to and it was a terrible feeling , the room lacked alot of amenities , the floor was wood which wasnt safe for my baby , there was blankets missing on the

Summary Heading: Excellant customer service, friendly and attentive staff
Summary: We would highly recommend staying at the Cozy Inn Costa Mesa. Good rooms at affordable prices, about $100-110 AUD per night, including taxes. We arrived very late and were greeted by friendly staff only too happy to help us with a competitive rate and as we were traveling as a part of our wedding anniversary we were upgraded to a bigger and better room at no additional cost. It doesn't hurt to ask for an upgrade! The room was spacious, clean and had a good size TV, with a functional and clean bathroom. The bed was large (King size) and very comfortable. Only one small negative was that some of the ceiling paint was peeling, only just noticeable and did not affect us at all. Otherwise, it is the best room we have had for that price on our trip so far.

i had looked forward to staying in this place because of the decent reviews, but i found it pretty disappointing overall.  its a nice enough location but the rooms seemed a little run-down.  for the money, the days-inn across the highway is a better option.

Cozy Inn is an older hotel and the man working the front desk could not have been nicer, I really enjoyed having him help me. If you are in search of a quiet room I would suggest calling ahead and get a room on the top floor and one towards the back of the property. The rooms are very spacious, and had a refrigerator, microwave, really large TV with great channels, and a nice lit up dressing mirror area.  I was all hotels have this nice dressing mirror area

Summary Heading: It has potential but right now it is dirty and smelly
Summary: The hotel has potential to be a great place. Rooms are spatious, furniture and amenities are ok, location is quiet. However, in the bathroom of my room there were empty toiletteries and hair from the previous guest, and there was a dead bug on the dirty carpet. In addition, ventilation of the room was poor which led to a horrible smell. For those reasons, I will not come back. There was another drawback, I was assigned a room on the second floor without elevator. So I had to carry my heavy luggage upstairs. I would have liked to know that in advance of my booking.

If you want a quiet facility and a clean nice room, stay here.  My room also contained a refrig., microwave and other basic amenities.  The Queen bed provided firm and soft comfort.  Along with the friendly staff and budget pricing, this motel offers a great value in the Costa Mesa area.

Ahead of a conference in Huntington Beach, I needed a place to stay. Based on review, Cozy Inn seemed to fit the bill.  I wasn't disappointed.  Clean, comfortable, and with welcoming staff.  The only mild irritant was one of the guests packing his car the morning I was leaving. Somehow he'd triggered the car's alarm, but was unperturbed by that, and just kept going for another ten minutes. Weird.  Not the hotel's fault. But weird.

Upon my check in, the gas station located right next to the inn had three police cars and they were arresting someone. Then when I pulled into the parking lot I could see a party going on in the room right below my room. They were smoking cigarettes as well as pot and playing loud music. The rooms were marked “no smoking “, which meant nothing. I was so tired that I just put my ear plugs in and went to sleep. The smoke did come in somehow through the vents , which was very annoying . I was able to sleep  in spite of this .  The next morning I could see in the daylight and  I found the bathroom walls dirty with Splatters of something that housekeeping did not bother to wipe off. As well as the drain area of the tub with rust stains or something. The carpets were dirty and

Stayed for 3 days, everything exceeded expectations.    The bed was comfortable, the blankets aren’t those wierd polyester patterned dark comforters that probably need sent to a lab but cotton blankets that you can see are clean. The microwave and fridge were clean and the room itself was pretty big, large TV with about 8 million channels. Maybe less channels but a lot.   The owners are awesome, anything I needed they had, they are very friendly and cool.   I read a lot of reviews before landing on this place and i am very glad I did.

What a great hotel and at a fraction of the price of most of the places this close to the beach. Rooms were clean, bed was comfortable and had everything needed for a comfortable stay. Management and staff are super friendly and accomodating. You can be at the beach in 5 minutes, shopping within 5 minutes and reasonably close to all the attractions in Orange County. Will definately stay here again on my next visit.

Good size room, quiet, very comfortable. Would stay again, easy access. WiFi was ok, not super but worked fine.  Close parking, employees were very nice, friendly, helpful.  Enjoyed the quiet space.... small pool, not much shade.

Summary Heading: Used it for years, will never use again.
Summary: They recently changed owners and the new owner refused to honer the written confirmation I had regarding price. He wanted cash. Rooms are very clean but internet hardly ever worked. After many years, too bad for them.

Room was much larger than expected.  Very clean.  Modern.  Simple.  Comfortable.   Staff was friendly and accommodating.  The gentleman at the front desk wanted to be sure we were happy and comfortable.  Eager to please customers. Location was fairly central to all that we needed.  Quiet area; though, the walls are thin.  Did not see any shady characters hanging around. Pool was very small, for those looking to swim.  Fridge in the room.   Good price, especially for the area.  Would definitely recommend booking directly with the office.  If I’m the area in the future, would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Affordable Gem in the heart of South Orange County
Summary: The customer service here is impeccable I’m helping me out in an emergency situation and it has every traveler ‘s dream: spotless, spacious rooms, excellent WiFi, ample, free parking and proximity to trendy Newport Beach and Costa Mesa attractions! Please check out Cozy Inn. Steve will work with you on price and is eager to accommodate!

I have been staying here for the past several years when visiting friends in the Costa Mesa area but this last time will be the last. There were meth heads in the parking lot all night trying to duck tape up their car for some reason. People going and coming at all hours of the night. Turns out there are several drug rehabs in the area and I guess this is where some of them end up.
Manager Response: Please accept our sincere apology.  Our greatest priority is the comfort of our clients. We take these issues very seriously and we regret that you had bad experience at our property. Please know that in future if you witness something like this, we will appreciate if you promptly bring it to our attention so that such issues can be rectified immediately. We have zero tolerance policy.  Your comfortable stay is our number one priority and hopefully you will give us another chance in future. Please feel free to contact us at 949-650-2055 or cozyinnoc@gmail.com if you have any other concerns.

Summary: Checking in and out, rooms being cleaned, all the staff were excellent. Love the hotel location with everything very close. Extended for an extra night. It was more like staying at someone's home rather than just another hotel room.

I have stayed here several times but this time might be the last. My room was on the bottom floor and it appears that the local drug rehab is in the area. There were several meth heads up all night long going in and out of their room every hour. I maybe got 3 hours sleep between the breaks when they left and came back. They were in and out of their room chain smoking on the balcony upstairs walking around like they had concrete in their shoes stomping on the floor. When I checked out in the morning they were in the parking lot trying to wire their car up with cut off electrical cords from a lamp.. If you are going to stay here I would suggest an upstairs room and get one close to the front office. The drug addicts are all in the back building. The rooms are very nice and clean

Summary Heading: Good value for a basic motel
Summary: The motel is fine for a short stay in this expensive area. It is quite basic - for example, there are no toiletries (just soap but no shampoo) but is clean enough and convenient. The pool is not heated.

Summary Heading: A great bargain, in the center of it all
Summary: This was an excellent room. The managers responded immediately to a minor complaint, and overall the room was spacious, clean, and quiet. I felt most comfortable (due to traffic) taking the car to find convenient restaurants for meals, but the ones I found were excellent, and within walking distance for braver souls.

Not the fanciest but frankly that isnt important to me jus need a bed to sleep that isnt my car. Wasn't dirty or run down and i dint feel unsafe. Thats why i feel its 5 stars, i got what i paid for which was enough.

My girlfriend and I stayed here for a night and everything was great overall. It was clean, had a tv, bed and a fridge. All you need if you're not a picky person and are poor. The next day we get a call saying they smelt marijuana. I go talk to the guy in the office and even invited him in. So he comes in to check the place out and says he smells pot. We do not smoke so that angered me. He proceeded to say he will talk to his manager. So we waited 2 hours and nothing happened. After that we felt we were being watched and were uncomfortable so we just left and didn't even return the room key. I'm very upset this happened because everything else was going so well. I know I didn't have to leave but it just felt weird after that and it's highly possible that they would've made us

Summary Heading: Not fancy, but good for a night or two
Summary: This motel is convenient to John Wayne airport, has fairly recently been renovated and was a good value.  The room was a decent size and, although close to the freeway, quiet.  I'm not sure that I'd want to stay for an extended time, but good choice for a night or two if you're looking for inexpensive accommodation.  Only downside was a slight ammonia-type smell in the bathroom.

After traveling 24 hours and suffering from 9 hours of time zone differences, we were not ready for the Cozy Inn.  The lights were on but nobody was home, and we could not get anyone's attention anywhere even ringing bells, shouting, and knocking on every door we could find.  We did find one client who was coming to find out why the advertised WiFi did not work, but that was it.  We went elsewhere and advise you to do the same.

We stayed here with friends during the summer and had a pleasant stay at this hotel. It has spacious rooms with good amenities. However the pool is quite small and is in the car park which is disappointing. Nevertheless this is a very good hotel and I would recommend this hotel.

First off it wasn't ready when we got there, had to come back. Then the toilet squealed the whole time, husband had to fix. No shampoo, no lotion, blow dryer didn't work, soap very tiny. Lamp was iffy. Very few outlets to plug things into. Phone rang about every 2 hours for no reason.Upstairs room even though I asked for a ground floor.All outlets are bad, nothing stays plugged in. The room is clean and the beds are comfortable. Great location too and the prices were good. Oh, and if you stay there ask for the wifi password. They don't tell you unless you ask.

The staff was not interested in doing his job, and the bed springs were the noisiest I have ever slept on.  The floating fake wood flooring was creepy, but the huge flat screen tv with a guide was very nice.

Stayed at Cozy Inn at Costa Mesa, Orange County with family. The rooms have 2 wueen sized beds. The room floors were wood tiles which was food in a way because it would lessen the chance of dust mites. Bathroom had a bath tub and was spacious too. Room had a microwave oven, a hair dryer, a big flat screen tv, an aircondition and heater too. Parking area was fine, they also had an outdoor pool but unfortunately was not able to try it. Place was peaceful and our stay went great. You would need to travel about a mile to get to the nearest fastfood chan or grocery.

I really wanted to give the Cozy Inn a higher grade, but our visit was "death by a thousand paper cuts". The good: Location! This motel is close to almost everthing the Newport/Huntington beach has to offer. It's a half a block from (busy) Newport Boulevard but tucked away so you'd never know it. NO noise from the nearby streets or shops!  The Cozy Inn offers free wifi, a huge TV with dozens of channels (including several HBO channels), a medium sized refrigerator, a microwave, and (for those who need it) an ironing board. The bad: The Inn was quiet, BUT....a high pitched whine would intermittenly emit from the toilet. Trial and error was used to discover that the whine could be stopped (temporarily) by flushing, closing the lid, or merely sitting upon it. (We were in room 11.

The room was large, clean and included a large flat screen television, microwave and refrigerator.  All of those things are positives.  The wi-fi worked well and HBO was included.  The price of the Queen bed was $96 including tax on a Sunday night.  A sign posted in the lobby said shampoo would be provided upon request.  We requested the shampoo and we were told it was in the room.  It was not.  We had our own shampoo so, okay.  The hair dryer in the room did not work.  We tried the reset button, other outlets, no luck.  But okay, I had my own hair dryer with us.  The high pitch sound coming from the toilet was not fun.  It took awhile to figure out that if pressure was put on the seat, and then the lid shut, the sound stopped.  I did not sleep until that was figured out at

I needed a clean, safe, quiet place to stay after 3 days in the hospital. This is an older building with some modern upgrades like the showerhead. My room #27 was spacious with a single queen bed, large tv, refrigerator and microwave. Everything was exceptionally clean: no bed bugs, no spiderwebs, dead bugs or cobwebs in the drapes or window sills. The bed mattress was comfortable, the pillows were small but perfectly adequate, and I received clean, fluffy towels everyday. This is not the Montage so bring your own toiletries. Even though the rooms were full, my room was very quiet and I slept like a baby. Downside: there is no elevator or porter to haul your luggage upstairs. If you do not get a ground level room and are handicapped, have bad knees or cant climb stairs, you are

Easy to find. GREAT location; close to so many things! The room was bigger than we expected and was very clean! Friendly staff - MJ was great, housekeeping ladies were so nice! FREE wi-fi! (unlike some more expensive places) Free parking. (unlike some more expensive places) Had both a fridge AND a microwave AND satellite t.v.  Didn't have to go through a lobby to get to our room; room door led right outside.  Quiet place. Very well, kept up - can tell the owners take pride in their property. But the best part? - - It was SO AFFORDABLE! We paid less than half the price of some other hotels that were close by. I will definitely stay there again if we ever go back to Costa Mesa.  I highly recommend this place. I don't think you will be disappointed.  :)

Came here based on other tripadvisor reviews, for an overnight stay.  Place was quite, It was a Sunday night. Room was clean and in good repair,  only faults I could find was a small coffee stain on the carpet, and the hair dryer was a bit weak on heat.  The internet was excellent  speed test showed 13.5 Mb/S. New looking HD Large flat screen TV, connected to a dish network receiver.   On the food side,  Room had fridge, coffee maker and microwave, No breakfast offered, there are no nearby food places.  However the beach is only about 10 min. drive with lots of food places.  They gave us a King bed room, in the second building, nice and quite. There is a pool, but we did not try it.  I would certainly come back here again

We are currently on a road trip and needed somewhere to stay in Costa Mesa. We searched and searched online to try to find something reasonably priced. We found the Cozy Inn, but it said online they were sold out. We were close to the motel, so decided to pop in. The man at the front desk was awesome. He got us a room and it was the same price being offered on booking.com. It was a great experience. The room itself was huge! We were pleasantly surprised. Bed was very comfortable. One big thing, it was so quiet....this was amazing!

Summary Heading: a very nice hotel in Costa Mesa
Summary: The room was huge! We had a huge TV as well. The staff was a little bit not so welcoming. The location is nice, it is within walking distance to the Triangle (a large mall with restaurants, bars, cinema, bowling, etc.). The free parking was also nice to have. Overall, I would stay there again.

You don't have to pay much and it is clean and quiet!  They don't give you shampoo or conditioner so make sure you have your own.  They are just a few minutes from Newport Beach which we loved.  The beds were fine I would suggest bringing your own pillow though.  Great place if you are just looking for somewhere to sleep for a great place in a great location.  Not too far of a drive away from disney either.

I made the reservation for the night on their hotel website but for some reason, when we went to go check in, they didn't have it. Thank goodness I printed out the confirmation so that we still got the right price. The hotel room was pretty nice with a newly remodeled tile shower. The only thing was that they don't have shampoo in the room, you need to ask for it. They are more than happy to work with you though! Also, it is right off of the highway so has easy access to the highway and close to shopping and restaurants! Overall great stay.

We had a king room on bottom floor. Called ahead to request a downstairs room as my husband had just put his back out. Very accommodating. Room was very clean and looked like it had recently been remodeled. Right off the 55 freeway. Coffee maker, refrigerator, ironing board, iron and hair dryer in room. Skimpy soap and no shampoo. But I read previous reviews and was prepared. Simply cannot beat the value for the price anywhere near there.

Summary Heading: Great Room, Value, Extended Stay, Location, and Staff
Summary: Work brought me to Orange County for an extended stay for the majority of 2015.  I found the Cozy Inn early in my assignment and am so very glad I did.  The rooms are modern, very clean, comfortable, and affordable.  The facility is off a main road located in a residential area so it is quiet and provides immediate access to the highway.  All needed amenities for 1 night, or 14 nights stay are all close by and within a few minutes walk.  The Newport Beach and ocean is just a 3 miles away.  The staff is very attenative and welcoming.  The Cozy Inn was my home away from home!

I stayed in this motel for 5 nights while attending classes. The room was clean, nothing fancy. Bring your own shampoo's, soap, etc. not provided. I was a little upset when I arrived and was assigned an upstairs room, after I requested a downstairs room. I have bad knees. Was told their wasn't any available?? You will have to ask for the internet connection, wasn't told on that either. Very quiet at night though and slept good. Fridge, Iron, blow dryer and microwave in room.

I originally planned to stay just one night, but my plans changed and I added 2 additional nights.   Room was spacious, clean and conveniently located and it had a microwave, frig, iron, TV and comfortable bed (no toiletries like shampoo).  I had a problem with the TV (I think my Grandson hit a wrong button) and the staff had it fixed by the time I returned a couple of hours later.  I was still in the area a week later and decided to stay one additional night.  The first room had hard wood floors with no carpets and the second room was fully carpeted, which I preferred.  Would stay again when I'm in the area.

I checked in to stay with my family and the rooms were dirty out dated I just came from another dive hotel! But this was worse 20 mins after check in they kicked my family and I out for no reason and wouldn't give a refund never again will I stay here

Having stayed in many motels and hotels during a 6 week road trip, this is one of the best budget places I have stayed!  Rooms were very spacious, clean and seemed quite modern. Also well equipped with wardrobe, fridge, TV, iron, ac etc. plus the bed was very comfortable!

We stayed here one night over Labor Day weekend and it was actually fine. The room was clean and the price was great. There were some people talking outside our room around 1 am but that is not the hotels fault. We were barely there so we basically just slept and left in the morning. The shower and bathroom were fine and pretty clean as well. i would stay there again If I just need a place for the night.

We chose this hotel because it was in a nice location to visit the OC Fair and it had decent ratings.. Locaion was nice, room was okay, dresser drawers messed up , obviously in need of updating , but our main complaint was the noise.. We stayed on the bottom floor in room 2, the room right above us was room 12. We got back to the hotel about 1 after the fair , and could everything happening above us very clear, then from 2 till 5 am we could hear the bed squeaky so loudly it woke us up from a sound sleep and kept us awake, this wasn't just  a faint noise, but sounded like someone was running on a treadmill right next to us.

I booked a room on June the eighth for one night (June 25-2015) We were traveling from Arizona. We were wondering what type of place we booked the ratings were not 5 star but not bad. We arrived about 45 min. before check in time and they gave us our room. The overall stay was wonderful room was clean very peaceful I recommend it to anyone.

Stayed in two different rooms at different times during my trip; both were excellent! Management and housekeeping staff were welcoming, respectful and polite! The rates were very reasonable and I'll definitely stay again in future! Overall a wonderful experience! Thank-you!

My husband and I were in Southern California on business and found this property to be perfect for our needs.  The hotel is close to Newport Beach, Balboa Island, Huntington Beach, San Clemente.  Easy access to the freeway and/or Pacific Highway, and even a 90 minute drive to San Diego.  If you are content with simple, clean, and easy on your budget, this is a find for a pricey area.   Great organic food market within walking distance as well as an Irish pup.  My only complaint is the inconsistency of the shower---sometimes hot, sometimes cool, and not a strong flow.

Summary Heading: Another stay at the Cozy Inn !
Summary: Another week long escape from the Colorado Mtns.mud season  visiting my son in Newport Beach and staying at the Cozy. For the cost aware but fussy traveler..the Cozy cannot be beat.. Great rates , large clean rooms , great location and for the somewhat noisy OC , a pretty quiet spot.

I didn't know this motel existed until last week and was pleasantly surprised. Small, with only 30 rooms (I believe), but that didn't bother me because that meant it was QUIETER and it was. It was large and clean, had very comfortable bed, with a fridge and microwave which was nice. Love the huge TV as well.  The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because the carpet was very worn and had a lot of stains of all sizes.

Considering the reasonable rate, of course I couldn't have been expecting the Four Seasons. However, the room was rather large with a good bed and decent bathroom. The decor was outdated---but again, for the price, I'm not complaining. It's not far from the freeway and very close to restaurants and Mother's Market.   No elevator, though---so make sure to specify if you need the ground floor.

Bed was a little soft for our liking and we had housekeeping knock on our door at 11.15 on our 1st morning (2night stay) telling us checkout time had passed. I had to tell her 3 times we were staying two nights! Wifi was ok but patchy and regularly dropped in & out. Otherwise the room was fine for our 2 night stop for a festival and some sight seeing in Newport.

I was going to a Deep Purple/Blue Oyster Cult concert at the Pacific Amphitheatre on the Orange County Fairgrounds, so I only needed a place to crash for the night.  I honestly picked this place because it was the cheapest one in the notoriously pricey Newport Beach/Costa Mesa area.  It was a tremendous surprise.  The room was large, very clean, the A/C was strong, the TV screen huge, the neighborhood very quiet.  At first, I wasn't sure how to operate the TV but the maintenance man came and helped us immediately.  Two large comfortable beds, a small pool (wish I'd known, I would have brought  a swim suit) and a friendly staff.  I actually was a little early but the clerk personally went to find us a room that housekeeping had finished.  For the price you'll be hard-pressed to

Summary Heading: Disappointed with staff, room was OK
Summary: We arrived to check in around 5:30 p.m.  The man that checked us in was not happy to see us.  There was no greeting, no welcoming, just a fill out this form, sign here.  What he did do was burp loudly as he was handing me the room key and telling me where our room was.  He didn't bother excusing himself, he just burped again as we turned around to walk out of the office.  YUCK!  We stayed in room 27, second floor of the back building.  The room was clean and very simply "decorated".  There were only two tiny soaps in the bathroom, so make sure you bring your own toiletries.  It is an inexpensive place to stay, and you will get what you pay for.

This is a great quiet clean family run hotel.  It's small and quaint and the owners are very friendly and easy to deal with.  We go to the beach in Newport Beach a couple of times a year and this is our pick to sleep good and not break the bank.

The Cozy Inn was a nice little hotel. It did the trick for all 5 of us. Beds were a bit hard. Close to Newport Beach about 20 min. away. We will be staying here again. If you plan on going bring shampoo and lotion.

As inexpensive a room as you will find in the area, and a really well maintained motel with friendly staff Nothing in the area is even close at this price. Comfortable bed and very clean rooms.  Five minutes to Newport Beach.

This hotel was a last minute decision.  We checked in and the night manager was very courteous and polite. The tv wasn't working so he came up himself and fixed the cable box.  The room was huge, nice new linens, and  52" flat screens.  The only complaint I have is that I wanted to get another night the next day.  The day staff is not very polite.  They said which they were full.  I understood but they were very rude about the 11am checkout which I already knew about. After the polite night manager said they were going to give us cash back for the deposit.  The day crew said it has to go back on your debit card. If you go here check in later in the day and if you want to stay for more than one day make sure you do it all at once so you don't have to deal with the day shift.

Location is not near sea but at entrance of newport. Convenient, if reaching in night, no traffic. Within 1 mile radius, there is club, mall, food, etc. Rooms are big, two big beds.  Rooms are clean and neat.

I booked this place because one of our party saw it and said it looked good. WELL, she was 100% right. Great price, clean as a whistle, and the owners as friendly as ol dog Shep. Helped us with directions, gave us discount cards and told us about a great place to eat, which I will review later. Overall, it was a bargain and it was perfect for our two night stay.

Summary Heading: Clean, nothing fancy but a perfect deal
Summary: There was no point in staying at a nicer hotel after finding this gem! Staff was great, room was clean and it was such a good deal we stayed an extra night. Unfortunately we checked out too early and thought we could get a better deal price wise at motel 6. Terrible idea, this place was night and day to motel 6 in Santa Ana, don't consider it and stay here!

The rooms are larger than normal. I don't recall an elevator, so lugging the suitcase to the second story maybe an issue for some people. It's not too far off a main roadway, yet I don't recall it being noisy. It had the basics, which was I knew what I was paying for. Nothing exciting, but nothing bad.

Summary Heading: Cheap cheap if you need to be in the area
Summary: We decided to stay here for two nights because the price was ok and ratings were above average. I agree about the huge rooms - twice normal. Fittings were average, not the cleanest and used. Some stains on carpet. But overall acceptable. The free WiFi works but although it seemed slow it was good enough for email. As we made the booking the search engine (not this one) claimed that they were almost full, but I don't think that was right as on both nights there was plenty of room! Location near  Newport Beach and Balboa was great so we spent some time there as there's not really a great deal to do in the area. It is in a quiet street. Summary Heading: Clean inexpensive hotel in Costa Mesa
Summary: This was a nice clean hotel with a big room in costa mesa right outside of Newport beach. Reasonably priced . Perfect short drive to the beach and attractions.  Room was nice. It had a very small swimming pool. Bed was comfortable and bathroom good. Large TV but had cable problems when I was there. This is a good budget alternative that felt very clean and safe to the large chains and some of the lower end stuff in the neighborhood.

Sorry folks, but the cost of a two night stay approached $100 a night with taxes and fees is a bit excessive for such a basic room. There is really not much of a swimming pool (more like a wading pool), not even a continental breakfast, parking is tight, very small bathroom (shower head about 5 feet high), wifi did not connect, TV was nice, bed was adequate, it's about 4 miles from the beach, and a stone's throw from the freeway.  Nothing in the way of a directory to help you choose restaurants, grocery stores, entertainment, etc.  Pretty poor in the voluntary customer service area. Sure, So. California is where the dollar is king, but this was the cheapest place that I could find near Huntington Beach.  So, if you are on a tight budget, this will do; but if you have more

Cozy Inn offers pretty good deal on the price compare to the other motels around Costa Mesa area. It is very close to fwy 55 and Newport Beach. Huntington Beach is also not too far away due west. There are two two-story complexes and a small swimming pool in between the two complexes of the property. Parking is free and close to the rooms.     The first room I checked into required more staff attention on its situation of unpleasant odor and mosquitoes flying around. This room was located on the 2nd floor of the complex in the back of the lot. I called the front desk and the staff apologized and reassigned a room on the 2nd floor of the front complex that is above the front desk. I was looking for a cheap place to stay while attending a conference and chose Cozy Inn because I saw some good reviews here. The room was really clean (not a speck of dust on the counter or the tables) which I didn't expect. Of course there were no frills and I had to trek down to the office to get shampoo when I wanted to wash my hair, but the room was very spacious and well worth what I paid.

My wife and I just spent 4 very enjoyable days at the Cozy.Our son lives in Costa Mesa and the Cozy provides us a very clean , well priced , quiet , relatively spacious  and well located lodging when we visit. All in all..for the price..it's tough to beat the Cozy for a SoCal extended or short trem visit.JWM

Summary Heading: About as good as it gets for the price
Summary: I was looking for a cheap place to stay while attending a conference and chose Cozy Inn for the good reviews.  The room was really clean (not a speck of dust on the counter or the tables) which I didn't expect.  Of course there were no frills and I had to trek down to the office to get shampoo when I wanted to wash my hair, but the room was very spacious and well worth what I paid.

Summary Heading: A budget Motel...close to Newport and the Beaches..!!
Summary: For a budget motel, minutes away from Newport and the beaches, I really can't think of too many negative things to say.  No, it's not a fancy hotel...it's a good-old motel. What I probably like the most is that the rooms are large...much larger than present day hotel rooms. Secondly, you can open the door...and windows, and get some FRESH air. That's something you can't do at most multistoried hotels.  It can be argued that the room is fairly spartan, but...it's clean, the bed is (somewhat) good, it has a mini-fridge, a micro wave, a fairly large flat screen TV and the Wi-Fi reception is very good. It also has air-conditioning and a small pool (in the middle of the parking lot) for those hot summer days. And...yes, parking is free.  There's no breakfast, Thank God, as I'm tired

Booking.com gives this location a good rating, but it is a terrible place to stay!  The rooms are basically clean, but the towels are the size of a hand towel and old and often see through.  The building is run down and has significant deferred maintenance.  The location is at best ghetto, including homeless and pan handlers.  The worse part is the management!  They appear to have little or no management experience, especially the older woman who works in the office, as she is not a nice person.  In fact she is mean and makes you feel like she is doing you a favor by letting you stay there.

Summary Heading: Very impressed. Couldn't find a fault.
Summary: It was the first Inn / Motel we ever stayed in, in any country and we were a bit anxious / nervous as to what to expect. We normally stay in Hotels but this was even better kitted out than hotels we've stayed in in the past. We were very impressed.    It was clean and tidy throughout - what more could we want. Fridge, microwave, spacious room & bright bathroom, big television, plenty channels to choose from, ironing board, table and chair, big dressing table (with good lighting), free wifi and free parking. Ideal for anyone really. We thought it was very well equipped.   I would come back to this accommodation again and would recommend it a friend. Pleasant stay in my opinion and just what we wanted as we were on a road trip.

I am in Costa Mesa quite often to visit my son.The Cozy was a very nice surprise.A bit older but very clean , good size rooms , quiet , great location and a nice price. Owners were also very friendly JWM

Summary Heading: Nice place for a one night stay.
Summary: For a one night stay this was a good choice. The facility is old in appearance, but makes up for that with a spacious room,  clean bathroom, and efficient check-in process. I can tell that motel is investing in the facility, but can improve more by opting for lighter shades of bed sheets and carpet. There are new appliances in the room, and the motel itself is minutes away from restaurants. I  could have given it 5 stars, but will wait for them to upgrade the rooms. However, I will not hesitate to stay there again. Overall, it was a good find through tripadvisor's reviews.

Summary Heading: Place to stay on a budget
Summary: We only stayed here over night while we were waiting to catch a flight out of the Santa Ana airport.  The owners were hospitable when we arrived late and the check-in was flawless.  We got to our king sized room which was rather large.  I don't know if they have role away beds, but you could easily fit one in here.  The room was clean, but had an ant problem in the bathroom.  This is a motel, so everything inside was low quality. The bed was the hardest bed I have ever slept on so if you like hard beds, this is for you.  The motel was quiet other than the guests above us who moved around a lot all hours of the night. The location was fine, right off of the 55.  It was 10 min. to the beach and to the airport.  I personally couldn't sleep here again because for me, the bed was way

Summary Heading: Great location, can't beat the price!
Summary: I've stayed at the Cozy Inn several times over the years, most recently in early June.  I have to say that - for the price and location - it really can't be beat!  The property is a little bit outdated, but generally well-maintained, and the rooms are large and clean with extra amenities including microwave and refrigerator.  The pool is small, but totally sufficient.  The motel certainly has more charm than a Motel 6 or something else in a comparable price range, and is 10 minute drive from Newport Beach.  It's also on a quiet street, and feels fairly secure - unlike some motels on Beach Blvd or Newport Blvd.  I found the proprietors to be very friendly and helpful, and overall I think the Cozy Inn is a great option if you are budget-conscious and want to be near the beach. Summary Heading: Not bad....for a Budget Motel close to Newport Beach!
Summary: We just spent a couple of nights at the Cozy Inn. Not bad for a budget motel! It is an older motel property so the rooms are large...or larger than at most newer motel properties. The room featured a mini fridge, a micro wave, a good sized flat screen TV and a reasonably comfortable bed. The bathroom was on the small side, and...being in a budget motel, don't expect luxurious towels, shampoo and similar extras. No breakfast was offered. There is a coffee maker in the room, but the brand of coffee didn't look all that "hot".  The room including the bathroom and carpeting was clean, and the walls had a fairly fresh coat of paint. Parking is free, and there is a small (mini) pool right in the middle of the parking lot...a somewhat strange location for a pool...!! Zero privacy.

I have stayed here several times over the past years but have found this place to be going downhill lately.  My last stay, 2/04/2012 was so disappointing that I will not stay there again. The bathroom had small towels, no soap, shampoo, etc., nice bathtub but no plug to take a bath.  Water had to run a long time to get hot and only one kleenex left in the box.  Panic set in when I found the blowdryer to be broken! Wanted to leave a note but had nothing to write with.  As a business traveler, I will be staying elsewhere.

My husband and brother in law were booked to stay here during the Orange County fair as they were working the during the whole month of the OC fair 2011. The company they were working for booked the room, so it was not their choice to stay here in the first place.   To start, the owner, I believe, her name is Nida and a man whom I believe was her husband were very rude. When asked any questions regarding their stay, she was very short with them and non customer service oriented. I actually stayed a few nights there as well as I was working the fair also. The beds were very hard and the the carpet was filthy. It is definitely a one star hotel. The pool is small and very uninviting.  If you go against my advice and decide to stay here, please make sure to bring your own towels.

Summary Heading: Good and clean motel with large rooms
Summary: A very good motel located nearby Los Angeles. Given the price (< $70), the rooms are unexpectedly large and very clean. The bed was very comfortable. The room is fitted with a desk & chairs, large TV (at least 40"), fridge,  microwave, ironing board... Large bathroom. Absolutely no noise, despite the Interstate being not so far (but a level below the street).  There is a free wifi hotspot in the motel, and a (small) pool (located in the middle of the - private - parking lot!). Front desk staff was friendly. The motel is a few minutes from the ocean, and 30 to 40 minutes from downtown LA. Definitively a good location for a night or two. Note: there is no breakfast or amenities of such sort, but restaurants are available all around.
A good report to this quiet motel in Costa Mesa. Pleasant, responsive staff. The room and bath were modern and exceptionally clean.  Great Wi-Fi.

The title says it all. 42" tv, hot shower, clean room, friendly and flexible staff, all for a really low price. And only a stone's throw from the beach (albeit a crappy one) and Norm's Restaurant, an adorable diner! It beats the local alternatives in value, and again, the staff was amazing!

Was 'passing through' Costa Mesa area and wanted to see a few different groups of friends and also be near Orange County Airport to pick up other friends arriving there.  Cozy Inn was conveniently located near everything.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  The room was a good size and included microwave and fridge.  Great value for the price and everything was clean and orderly.

Good sized motel room. We had 1 double room which was a huge room. Room included fridge and microwave.  We booked through Expedia and when we were in Los angeles staying elsewhere we wanted to cancel a couple of nights ( we had not paid any money at this point they only had our credit card details in case we did not show) at Cozy inn so we could travel to Las vegas first. We phoned Cozy inn to see if we could do this. Spoke to a young guy who was not very helpful and he told us we had to get in contact with Expedia direct.
